title: spack compiler add uses relative path
body:
If fed a relative path, `spack compiler add` will write the relative path to compilers.yaml rather than dereference it to the absolute path. This behavior began with commit 6d56d4545472ddff1cdc0e8fd49d8260428a141e according to `git bisect`.



### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack compiler add --scope=site ../apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.3-4vf3wugrvromolotwrco5vuzydnts3bv/
==> Added 1 new compiler to /opt/packages/gpjohnsn/opt/ssoft/spack/etc/spack/compilers.yaml
    intel@19.0.3.199
==> Compilers are defined in the following files:
    /opt/packages/gpjohnsn/opt/ssoft/spack/etc/spack/compilers.yaml
$ cat etc/spack/compilers
...
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: centos7
    paths:
      cc: ../apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.3-4vf3wugrvromolotwrco5vuzydnts3bv/bin/icc
      cxx: ../apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.3-4vf3wugrvromolotwrco5vuzydnts3bv/bin/icpc
      f77: ../apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.3-4vf3wugrvromolotwrco5vuzydnts3bv/bin/ifort
      fc: ../apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.3-4vf3wugrvromolotwrco5vuzydnts3bv/bin/ifort
    spec: intel@19.0.3.199
    target: x86_64
...
```
```console
Previous, and expected, output:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: centos7
    paths:
      cc: /opt/packages/gpjohnsn/opt/ssoft/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.3-4vf3wugrvromolotwrco5vuzydnts3bv/bin/icc
      cxx: /opt/packages/gpjohnsn/opt/ssoft/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.3-4vf3wugrvromolotwrco5vuzydnts3bv/bin/icpc
      f77: /opt/packages/gpjohnsn/opt/ssoft/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.3-4vf3wugrvromolotwrco5vuzydnts3bv/bin/ifort
      fc: /opt/packages/gpjohnsn/opt/ssoft/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.3-4vf3wugrvromolotwrco5vuzydnts3bv/bin/ifort
    spec: intel@19.0.3.199
    target: x86_64
...

```
Loading the respective module first will do the right thing but using a relative path in the `spack compiler` command used to work. Also, it seems that a relative path should never be written to compilers.yaml.
